awardsHtml:
16 wins & 45 nominations

Primetime Emmy Awards

1991 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Lead Actor in a Drama Series
Kyle MacLachlan (For playing "Dale Cooper".)
1991 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Sound Editing for a Series
Richard Taylor (supervising editor) - Pat McCormick (sound editor) - Richard F.W. Davis (sound editor) - Thomas DeGorter (sound editor) - Albert Edmund Lord III (supervising adr editor) - Lori L. Eschler (supervising music editor) (For episode #25.)
1991 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Sound Mixing for a Drama Series
Don Summer (production mixer) - Gary Alexander (re-recording mixer) - Adam Jenkins (re-recording mixer) (For episode #25.)
1991 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series
Piper Laurie (For playing "Catherine Martell".)
1990 Nominee Primetime Emmy
Outstanding Main Title Theme Music
Angelo Badalamenti (composer) - David Lynch (composer)

Television Critics Association Awards

2016 Nominee Heritage Award
2015 Nominee Heritage Award
2014 Nominee Heritage Award
2013 Nominee Heritage Award
2012 Nominee Heritage Award

Academy of Science Fiction, Fantasy & Horror Films, USA

2015 Winner Saturn Award
Best DVD/Blu-Ray Television Release
(For the "Twin Peaks: The Entire Mystery" release.)
2008 Winner Saturn Award
Best Retro Television Release on DVD
(For "The Definitive Gold Box Edition" release.)

Satellite Awards

2007 Nominee Satellite Award
Best DVD Release of a TV Show
(For season 2.)

TV Land Awards

2006 Nominee TV Land Award
Favorite Dream Sequence
(Dream sequences featuring "The Man From Another Place".)

Online Film & Television Association

2006 Winner OFTA TV Hall of Fame
Television Programs

Cahiers du Cinéma

2000 Nominee Best Film of the 1990s
Best Film
David Lynch (Fourth Place; tied with Close Up (1990), Eyes Wide Shut (1999), and Erbarmungslos (1992))

1992 Winner TV Prize

1991 Nominee Soap Opera Digest Award
Outstanding Prime Time Soap

1991 Winner Golden Globe
Best Television Series - Drama
1991 Winner Golden Globe
Best Performance by an Actor in a Television Series - Drama
Kyle MacLachlan
1991 Winner Golden Globe
Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role in a Series, Miniseries or Motion Picture Made for Television
Piper Laurie
1991 Nominee Golden Globe
Best Performance by an Actress in a Supporting Role in a Series, Miniseries or Motion Picture Made for Television

Directors Guild of America, USA

1991 Nominee DGA Award
Outstanding Directorial Achievement in Dramatic Series - Night
Lesli Linka Glatter (For episode "Episode 32006".)

American Society of Cinematographers, USA

1991 Nominee ASC Award
Outstanding Achievement in Cinematography in Movies of the Week/Pilots
Ronald Víctor García (Episode: "Pilot (1989)")

Grammy Awards

Best Instrumental Composition Written for a Motion Picture or for Television
Angelo Badalamenti (For the soundtrack.)
1991 Winner Grammy
Best Pop Instrumental Performance
Angelo Badalamenti (For the theme)

Peabody Awards

1991 Winner Peabody Award
(For episode "Pilot (#1.1)". (For the pilot episode).)

TP de Oro, Spain

1991 Winner TP de Oro
Best Foreign Series (Mejor Serie Extranjera)

Best Actor in a Quality Drama Series
Kyle MacLachlan
